00035 typedef enum {ROTARY_TOOL,TURNING_TOOL, UNDEFINED} TOOLTYPE;
00036 class tool {
00037   public:
00038     const TopoDS_Face& getProfile() const {assert (valid);return profile;};
00039     TOOLTYPE getType() const {return type;};
00040     bool isValid() const {return valid;};
00041   protected:
00042     tool();
00043     //bool isRotaryTool;
00044     bool valid; //TODO: what is this? valid wire? valid solid? input sanity check? or ???
00045     bool bruteForceOnly; //for creating solid. FIXME:would it make more sense in another class?
00046     const TopoDS_Face& profile;
00047     TOOLTYPE type;
00048 };

00055 typedef enum { BALLNOSE, CYLINDRICAL, TOROIDAL, ENGRAVING, TAPERED, OTHER, UNDEF } SHAPE_TYPE;
00056 class millTool: protected tool {
00057   public:
00058     //getProfile() = 0;
00059     SHAPE_TYPE getShape() const {return shape;};
00060     const TopoDS_Solid& getRevol();
00061     const TopoDS_Face& getProj(degrees deg);
00062   protected:
00063     millTool();
00064     SHAPE_TYPE shape;
00065     double dia,len; //diameter, length
00066     const TopoDS_Solid& revol;
00067 };
00068 
00074 class aptTool: protected millTool {
00075   public:
00076     aptTool(double dd,double aa,double bb,
00077             degrees AA,degrees BB, double ll);
00078   private:
00079     double a,b; //d and l are in millTool
00080     degrees A,B;
00081 };

00088 class ballnoseTool: protected millTool {
00089   ballnoseTool(double diameter, double length);
